law.catch_line: Kentucky National Guard and Reserve Employers' Council -- Membership -- Meetings.

text.section: There is created a committee to be known as the Kentucky National Guard and Reserve Employers' Council, which shall be attached to the Office of the Adjutant General for administrative purposes only.
The council shall select one (1) of the appointed members as chairman.

Initially, three (3) of the members shall be appointed to serve for a period of four (4) years, two (2) of the members shall be appointed to serve for a period of three (3) years, and two (2) of the members shall be appointed to serve for a period of two (2) years. Thereafter, members shall be appointed for a period of four (4) years.
Members shall serve without pay, and shall not be reimbursed for travel expenses.
A majority of members shall constitute a quorum.
The council shall meet as often as necessary, but it shall meet not less than two (2) and not more than six (6) times annually.

law.history: Created 2003 Ky. Acts ch. 158, sec. 1, effective June 24, 2003.

metadata.lrc-note: (6/24/2003). Although 2003 Ky. Acts ch. 158, sec. 1, directed that this section be created as a new section of KRS Chapter 40, the statute has been codified in KRS Chapter 36 because, given the subject matter of the section, this is the more logical placement. See KRS 7.136(1)(a).
